ï»¿OFFICIAL iF or q3 The World Bank ---.m teet.W (202) 473-1000 INTERNATIONAL BANK FOR RECONSTRUCTION AND DEVE-OPMENT Washington, D.C. 20433 Cable Address: INTBAFRAD INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION U.S.A. Cable Address: INDEVAS ,2012 M%r. Paul Samson D)irector General Multilateral Development Institutions Directorate Multilateral and Global Progrzms Branch C'anadian International Develcpment Agency 200 Promenade du Portage (ratineau, Quebec IIA 0G4 Trust Fund Administration Arrangement between Government of Canada as represented by the Minister for International Cooperation, acting tbrough the Cirnadian International Development Agency and the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and the International Development Association concerning the Umbrella Facility for Gender Equality (UFGE) Multi-Donor Trust Fund (No. TFO71893) Dear Mr. Samson: 1 We are pleased to acknowledge on behalf of the International Bank for ;',econstruction and Development ("IBRD") and the International Development Association ("WA") (collect.vely, the "Bank") that the Government of Canada, as represented by the Minister for International Cooperation, acting through the Canadian Iiternational Development Agency (CIDA) (the "Donor") hereby approves to transfer to the Umbrella Facility for Gender Equality (UFGE) Multi-Donor Trust Fund (the "Trust Fund") the unused amounts in the Multi Donor Trust Fund for the Gender Action Plan TF070751 attributable to the [lono- (the "Contribution") in accordance with the terms of this Arrangement. Other doncrs are also expected to contribute to the Trust Fund on the tcerms and conditions specified in te Annexes to this Arrangement. 2 The Cooltribution will be used to finance the activities and the categories of expenditure set forth in the "Description of Activities, Allocation of Funds and Expenditures under the UFGE Multi-Donor Trust Fund" attached hereto as Annex 1, and , ill be adminisered by the Be nk on behalf of the Donor in accordance with the terms of this Arrangement including the "Standard Provisions Applicable to the UFGE Multi- Donor Trust Fund" (the "Standard Provisions") attached hereto as Annex 2 and "Governance and Other Terms Applicable to the UFGE Multi Donor Trust Fund" attached hereto as Annex 3.
ï»¿-2- 3. The Contribution will c)nsi;t of the remaining funds from the Gender Action Plan (GAP) (TF070751) Multi-Don:r Trust Fund. Accordingly, the Donor hereby authorizes the Bank, promptly following countersignature of this Arrangement, to transfer the ariount of one hundred fifty-tvio thousand, five hundred and twenty seven United States Do lars and sixty cents (USD152,527.60) plus the Donor's pro-rata share of any investment income that may have accrued until the date of transfer from the GAP Trust Fund (TF070751) to the Umtrella Facility for Gender Equality (UFGE) Multi-Donor Triist Fund, (TFO71893). 4. Any notice, request oi other communication to be given or made under this Arrangement will be in writ ng and delivered by mail, facsimile or e-mail to the respective signatory's address ;pecified below or at such other address as such signatory nol:ifies in writing to the other signatory from time to time: For the Bgnk: Sarah Nedolast Senior Program Coordinator Gender and Development The World Bank 1818 H Street, NW Washington, DC 20Z33 Tel: 202-473-2890 Fax: 202-522-3,37 E-mail: snedolast@worldbank.org For the Donor: Mr. Vaughn Lartz Director, Intermtional Financial Institutions Division Multilateral DeN elopment Institutions Directorate Multilateral and Global Programs Branch Canadian Intern itional Development Agency 200 Promenade du Portage Gatineau, Quebec Tel: 819-953-0386 Fax: 819-953-5'48 E-mail: vaughn.Iantz(Liacdi-cida.gc.ca
ï»¿-3- 5. Notwithstanding sectic,n 3.1 of Annex 2 of this Administration Arrangement, the 3ank will not deduct and will not retain for its own account, the amount of 2% referred lo in such section, from tie funds that are being transferred upon the Donor's instructions from the GAP Trust Fund (TF070751), as Contribution to this UFGE TF 071893. 6. All annexes hereto :onstitute an integral part of this Arrangement. This Arrangement rmay be modif ed only in writing between the Bank and the Donor; provided, however, that such annexes may be modified only with the acceptance of all donors contributing to the Tru:;t Fund. 7. Please c nfirm your ur derstanding with the foregoing, on behalf of the Donor, by svgning and datIng the two originals, retaining one original for your record and returning the other original to the Banl. Upon receipt by the Bank of the original Arrangement countersigned by you, this Arrangement will become effective as of the date of the countersignature. It is unders.ood that this Arrangement is not an international treaty. It is an administrative arrangement between the Donor and the Bank. Sincerely, INTERNATIONAL BANK FOR RECONSTRUCTION AND DEVELOPMENT INTERNATIOINAIL DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION Temt g an Director Gende and Development AGREED: GOVERNMENT OF CANAA as represented y the Minister for International Cooperation, acting through the Canadian International Devloprment Agency (CIDA) By: Date: ZO(. -i(-I? Nlame: Hlr,40LwIfrt P'. vasuo Tile DVelv g'At
ï»¿-4- ANNEX 1 Description ot Activities, Criteria for Allocation of Funds, and Expenditures under the [UFGE Multi-Donor Trust Fund This Annex will be applicable to and form an integral part of all agreements entered into between the Baik and entities (collectively, the "Donors") that provide contributions (the aggregate o F all contributions from the Donors, the "Contributions") to be administered by the Bank for the Trust Fund. A. DESCRIP'ION OF ACTIVITIES The main objective of the '[rust Fund is to strengthen awareness, knowledge, and (apacity for gender-informed )olicy making and programs. The Trust Fund will support activities that contribute to be ter gender-informed policy making at the country level by increasing the availability of gender-relevant data and evidence; contribute to global knowledge by toad testing new evidence; and help raise awareness of and demand for gender equality interventions by working in partnership with client governments, civil society, research institutes, acEdemia, the private sector, and development partners. Activities The Trust Fund will finance ictivities with a strong 'public good' element, as well as those that are innovative and push the frontiers of gender equality work. Activities to be financed by the Trust Fund wil 1 fall under three main priority areas: 1. Increasing availability of gender-relevant data and evidence. Activities will include addressing data gaps, making existing data more accessible and building evidence in frontier areas and those where gender gaps persist. i. Road testing new e- idence. Activities will include identifying relevant lessons on how developmeni practitioners can effectively translate new evidence into results on the ground, such as strengthening and expanding successful approaches. Ill. Leveraging partnerships to help advance gender equality. Under this activity the Bank wi 1 engage civil society and private sector, especially from developing client countries to identify, disseminate and implement innovative gender equality initia:ives. The implementation of the activities to be financed by the Trust Fund is as follows: (1) Bank-Executed Trust Fund .Activities:
ï»¿-5- (a) Activities relatod to priority areas I (Increasing availability of gender- relevant data and evidence) II (Road testing new evidence), and III (Leveraging partnerships) mentioned above. (b) Program Mar agement, Program Administration and Knowledge Management: The PREM Gender and Development Group (PRMGE) will coordinate the day to day activities including leveraging global partnerships, aggregate knowledge management activities and administering the Trust Fund, working in close collaboration with regions and networks. (1l) Recipieot-Executed Tnst Fund Activities: (a) Activities related to priority areas I (Increasing availability of gender- relevant data and evidence), and II (Road testing new evidence). II. CRITERW FOR ALLOCATION OF FUNDS The Gender an4 Development (GAD) Board is responsible for allocation decisions, and ensuring that such allocation; are aligned with the objectives of the UFGE and the strategy for gender mainstreamring in the Bank. The GAD Board will make allocation decisions based on the following general criteria: * Alignment with the Bank's strategy for gender mainstreaming. * Alignment with Regior al needs and priorities, as laid out in the Regional Gender Action Plans. * Alignment with the overall objectives of the UFGE: to strengthen awareness, knowledge and capacity for gender-informed policy making. * Extent to which activities have a strong public-good rationale and/or are catalysts for innoVation and investment in frontier issues and persistent gaps. Fands under the, UFGE will mainly be allocated through: B. 1. Strategic Allocations a) Strategic Activities: Activities related to priority areas I (Increasing availability of gender-relevant data and evidence) II (Road testing new evidence), and III (Leveraging partnerships) mentioned above. b) Regional Block Grants (for both, Bank and Recipient execution): These will cover a three-year period and be considered once every 18 months, depending on funding availability. Proposals must be endorsed by the Regional Vice President. The GAD Board will review and approve proposals based on the criteria above.
ï»¿-6- B. 2. Competitive Calls foi Proposals 4j portion of the Trust Fund may be used for competitive calls for proposals for Bank executed activities. The inlent of this mechanism is to incentivize Bank teams to undertake activities in areas where the agenda on gender equality needs a push. It might also be used to address areas where the implementation of the 2012 WDR is lagging. A Technical Review Commit:ee, consisting of World Bank experts, would be convened to establish criteria for a call for proposals and to review and rank those that are submitted. The GAD Board will endorse the criteria and clear the selection of proposals. 113. 3. PRMGE Managed Allocation The focus under this allocation is priority area III (leveraging partnerships) as described above, as well as activities that will include aggregate knowledge management and 1JFGE's Program management and administration, to be carried out by PRMGE. C. ELIGIOLE CATEGORIES OF EXPENDITURE For Bank-Executed activities the Contributions may be used to finance: (a) consultants' services (individuals and firms); (b) extended term consultants (c) associated oveiheads (e.g., telephone, fax, internet connection expenses during mission travel, telecommunications for learning events, etc.); (d) contractual serN ices; (e) staff costs, benefit, and indirects (e.g., communications, use of office space and IT equipment by staff, etc.); (f) travel expenses (including travel related charges and subsistence for staff, consultants and workshop participants, etc.); (g) media, workshop, conference and meeting expenses (including external participant costs, honoraria, facilities for events, etc.); and (h) temporary supp rt staff costs. For Recipient-14xecuted activ ties, the Contributions may be used to finance eligible expenditures in accordance with the Bank's applicable policies and procedures. The foregoing categories of expenditures may include the financing of taxes.
ï»¿-7- ANNEX 2 Standarl Provisions Applicable to the UFGE Multi-Donor Trust Fund This Annex shall be a:plicable to and form an integral part of all agreements en ered into between the Bz nk and the Donors that provide Contributions to be ad:iinistered by the Bank for th.e Trust Fund. 1. Administtation of the Contr [butions 1.1 The Bank shall be responsible only for performing those functions specifically set forth in this Agroement and shall not be subject to any other duties or responsibilities to the Donors, including, without limitation, any duties or obligations that might otherwise app_ly to a fiduci4ry or trustee under general principles of trust or fiduciary law. Nothing in ihis Agreement shall be considered a waiver of any privileges or immunities of the IBRD and IDA under their Articles of Agreement or any applicable law, all of which are expressly reserved. 1.2. The Contribution shall be administered in accordance with the Bank's applicable policies and procedures, as the same may be amended from time to time, including its framework to prevent and combat fraud and corruption and its screening procedures to prevent the use of Bank resources to finance terrorist activity, in line with the Bank's obligations to give effect to the relevant decisions of the Security Council, taken under Chapter VII of the of Charter of the United Nations. The Donor acknowledges that this provision does not create any obligations of the Bank under the anti-terrorist financing anc asset control laws, regulations., rules and executive orders of an individual member cou.ntry that may apply to the Donor, nor shall it be deemed a waiver, express or implied, of any of the privileges and immunities of the Bank. 2. Commingling, Exchan e and Investment of the Contributions 2.1. The Contributions shal be accounted for as a single trust fund and shall be kept separate and apart from the furids of the Bank. The Contributions may be commingled with other trust fund assets maintained by the Bank. 2.2. The Contributions may be freely exchanged by the Bank into other currencies as may facilitate their disburseme it. 2.;. The Bank shall invest and reinvest the Contributions pending their disbursement in accordance with the Bank's policies and procedures for the investment of trust funds administered by the Bank. The Ballk shall credit all income from such investment to the Trust Fund to be used for the same purposes as the Contributions.
ï»¿3. Administrative Cost Recovery 3.1 The Bank may deduct and retain for its own account, as a deduction from each Insrallment, an amount equal to two percent (2%) per Installment as an administrative fee for the Trust Fund. 3.2 In addition, costs incurred by the Bank for other expenses, such as for program management and Trust Fund administration, that are (i) not covered by the percentage de:duction specified above as an administrative fee and (ii) not included under Annex 1 of the Administration Agreemenis in accordance with the Bank's applicable policies and procedures shall be charged to the Trust Fund on an actual basis up to a maximum of three percent (3%) of the total Contributions under all Administration Agreements. 3.3 Each Donor acknowlec ges and agrees that the percentage deductions for fees in this Trust Fund Fees and Costs section are estimated on the basis of anticipated Coitributions. If actual Contributions significantly differ from what was originally anticipated at the time of signature of the first Administration Agreement, or if other circumstances affecting Trust Fund fees or costs change, the Bank reserves the right to request a change to the terms of this Trust Fund Fees and Costs section, which would be efiectuated by amendments imde to the Administration Agreements of all Donors and which would thereafter be app icable to all new Contributions that are provided either as amendments to supplement existing Administration Agreements or from new Donors under new Administration Agreements. 4. Grants to Recipients 4. . The Bank shall, as administrator of the Trust Fund on behalf of the Donors, enter into grant agreements (the "Grant Agreements") with eligible recipients selected in accordance with the Criteria f)r Allocation of Funds under Annex 1 (the "Recipients") consistent with the purposes o this Agreement and on the terms and conditions set forth in :he Grant Agreements. Grant Agreements may be entered into up to the maximum amount of the Contributions that all Donors have agreed to make available under the Administration Agreements b.tween the Bank and the Donors. Upon request by a Donor, the Bank shall furnish E copy of the Grant Agreements to the Donors. 4.2. The Bank shall be resp,nsible for the supervision of the activities financed under the Grant Agreements. Subject to the consent of the relevant Recipients, representatives of the Donors may be invited by the Bank to participate in Bank supervision missions related to the Trust Fund. 4.:;. The Bank shall promptly inform the Donors of any significant modification to the terms of any Grant Agreement; and of any contractual remedies that are exercised by the Bank under any Grant Agreements. To the extent practicable, the Bank shall afford the
ï»¿-9- Donors the opportunity to exchange views before effecting any such modification or ex.rcising any such remedy. 5. Procurement 5.1 For Recipient-executed activities, the Grant Agreements shall provide that the Contributions shall be used by th. Recipients to finance expenditures for goods and services, as the case may be, in accordance with the Bank's Guidelines on "Procurement unJer IBRD Loans and IDA Credits" and the Bank's Guidelines on the "Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers," as in effect at the date of entry into the respective Grant Agreements. 5.2 For Banktexecuted acti vities, the employment and supervision of any consultants an.] the procurement of an, goods financed by the Contributions shall be the responsibility of the Bank and shEll be carried out in accordance with its applicable policies and procedures. 6. Accounting and Financial Reporting 6.1 The Bank shall maintain separate records and ledger accounts in respect of the Contributions deposited in the Trus:. Fund account and disbursements made therefrom. 6.2. The Bank shall furnish to the Donors current financial information relating to receipts, disbursqments and fund balance in the holding currency of the Trust Fund with respect to the Contributions via the World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Center secure website. Within six (6) months after all commitments and liabilities under the Trust Fund have been satisfied and the Tiust Fund has been closed, the final financial information relating to receipts, disbursements and fund balance in the holding currency of the Trust Fund with respect to the Contributions will be made available to the Donors via the World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Center secure website. 6.1. The Bank shall provide to the Donors, within six (6) months following the end of each Bank fiscal year, an annual single audit report, comprising (1) a management assertion together with an attestation from the Bank's external auditors concerning the adequacy of internal control over cash-based financial reporting for all cash-based trust funds as a whole; and (2) a combined financial statement for all cash-based trust funds together with the Bank's external auditor's opinion thereon. The cost of the single audit shall be borne by the Bank. 6.4. If a Donor wishes to request, on an exceptional basis, a financial statement audit by the Bank's external audito -s of the Trust Fund, the Donor and the Bank shall first consult as to whether such an external audit is necessary. The Bank and the Donor shall agree on the appropriate sccpe and terms of reference of such audit. Following agreement on the scope and terms of reference, the Bank shall arrange for such external
ï»¿- 10- audit. The costs of any such audit, including the internal costs of the Bank with respect to uch audit, shall be paid by tie requesting Donor. 6.5 The Bank shall provid. the Donors with copies of all financial statements and auJitors' reports received by the Bank from the Recipient(s) pursuant to the Grant AE-eements. 7. Progress Reporting 7.1. The Bank shall provide the Donors with an annual report on the Trust Fund progress. Within six (6) months of the final disbursement date specified in paragraph 8.2, the Bank shall furnish to the Donors a final report on the Trust Fund progress. 7.2 Any Donor may review or evaluate activities financed by the Trust Fund. The Doior and the Blank shall agree on the scope and conduct of such review or evaluation, anc the Bank shoill provide all relevant information within the limits of its policies and procedures. All associated costs shall be bome by the Donor. It is understood that any such review or evaluation will not constitute a financial, compliance or other audit of the Trist Fund. 8. Disbursement; Cancell tion, Refund 8.1. The Contributions mEy be used to retroactively finance payments made as of Juiie 01, 2012 for eligible expenditures in accordance with the Bank's policies and procedures. 8.2 It is expected that the Contributions will be fully disbursed by the Bank by June 30., 2017. The Bank shall only disburse Contributions for the purposes of this Agreement after such date with the written approval of the Donors. 8.3 Any Donor or the Bank may, upon three (3) months' prior written notice, cancel all or part of the Donor's pro rata share, of any remaining balance of the Contributions that is not committed pursuant to any agreements entered into between the Bank and any coi-sultants and/6r other third parlies for the purposes of this Agreement prior to the receipt of such notice, includin, the Grant Agreements. 8.4. Followin the final dis ursement date specified in paragraph 8.2, the Bank shall return any remaining balance cf the Contributions to the Donors or to the relevant Donor Balance Account on a pro rati basis based on the Donors' paid Contributions. In the event of a cancellation the Bank shall promptly return to the relevant Donor or Donors or to the relevant Donor Balance Account the Donor's pro rata share of uncommitted Contributions in accordance with paragraph 8.3.
ï»¿9. Disclosure: Dispute Re&olution 9.1 The Bank shall disclos.- the Administration Agreements and related information on this Trust Fund in accordance vith the Bank's Policy on Access to Information. By en-ering into Administration Agreements, the Donors consent to such disclosure of their respective Admin istration Agr ements and such related information. 9.21 The Donors and the Bank shall use their best efforts to amicably settle any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to the Administration Agreements.
ï»¿- 12 - ANNEX 3 oovernance a0d Other Terms Applicable to the UFGE Multi-Donor Trust Fund The following governance terrr s will apply to the Gender Equality (UFGE) Trust Fund: 1. The Donors agree thal the Bank has responsibility for Trust Fund operations under the terms of this Administration Arrangement, including with respect to the allocation of funds, the implerentation of Bank-executed activities and the supervision of Recipient-exeeuted activities. For clarity, decisions on work programs and allocation of finds will be Made by the Bank. 2. The Bank agrees to convene annual meetings to which all Donors are invited ("Annual Consulations"). The putpose of the Annual Consultations is for the Bank and the Donors to discuss: a) Results (as defined belcw) presented by the Bank; b) future program plans presented by the Bank; c) broad strategic guidance refective of (a) and (b). 3. "Results" will be repor ed by the Bank and reviewed at the Annual Consultations on the basis of a results framework for the Trust Fund issued by the Bank upon eslablishment of the Trust FL nd, derived from the results framework of the relevant Bank-endorsed sector / themaiic strategy and providing sufficient granularity to reflect the anticipated contribution of the Trust Fund, as may be modified over time to reflect ac. al Contributions and other external factors. 4. Progress reporting will Dccur on a unified, common basis for all Donors.
